data.label: Fastest code is code that doesn't exist
Use tools that work / prefer stability

data.title: Agent audit and maintenance decisions v0

summary.high_level: Records resolved maintenance policy choices from the audit loop, including index update mode and first vision-alignment KPI anchor.
Designed a standalone CLI tool (sb) to handle scene and session commits, JSON validation, and index rebuilding. Establishes minimal 3-capability commit agent contract.
key_decisions: Use standalone CLI (not embedded in Codex or project repo).
Agent contract limited to grounding (read), commit (write), and index/validation (maintain).
Projects remain structured locally; second-brain references them via Project Map scenes.
Adopt Intake → Draft → Publish conceptual pipeline for future automation.
summary.architectural_shift: Transition from structured-manual workflow to automatable commit-layer infrastructure.

data.label: Four principles that separate successful AI builders (second brain case study)

summary.high_level: Defines invariant-to-mechanism mappings, escalation policy, and anti-entropy ingest rules.
summary.details: Encodes one primary mechanism per invariant and downgrades overlap to track-only unless explicit core-gate escalation is approved.

data.title: Hyperfast Agent Closeout v0

summary.high_level: Defines protocol for agent-executed hyperfast sessions inside second-brain: file-I/O only, zero-dependency resumption, threshold-gated closeout, auto-indexing, and scene-fold suggestions.
summary.details: Builds on hyperfast pocket card/checklist/ontology and the generalized closeout contract. Targets delegation where agents can self-initiate, execute, close, and maintain with human approval only at explicit gates.

data.resumption_notes: Load taxonomy + alias map policy, last three high-score artifacts from sessions/*/index.json, and this scene before executing.
open_questions: 1. Should agent execution include optional human-approval gate for next_steps > 3 items?
2. How should multi-agent coordination (audit agent vs execution agent) use scene locking semantics?
next_steps: 1. Run agent-owned loop via tools/sb_agent_audit_loop.sh and review scene suggestions.
2. Validate protocol assumptions against one live project session.
3. Ingest updated scenes using tools/sb_graph_ingest_v0.sh and compare KPI delta.
thinking_trace_attachments: Rationale: hyperfast patterns accelerate human loops; explicit file-I/O protocol and closeout gates enable agent delegation while staying tool-agnostic.

prompt_lineage.summary: Expand hyperfast integration for agent delegation per audit resolutions

hyperfast_agent_protocol.overview: Step-by-step file-driven protocol for hyperfast agent sessions. No external APIs or DB required.

load_sequence: 2. Hyperfast kit scenes (pocket card, checklist, ontology)

llm_simulation_placeholder.description: For offline testing, replace live LLM calls with deterministic fixture replay from local JSON/text files.

phase_1_init.description: Parse trigger and initialize session state.

phase_2_hyperfast_loop.description: Run constrained 3-5 iteration execution loop using hyperfast checklist/ontology.

phase_3_closeout.description: Generate contract-compliant artifact, validate thresholds, auto-index, suggest scene fold.

phase_4_resumption_primitives.description: Expose deterministic cold-resume and audit hooks for chained sessions.

error_handling.rollback: Clean temp state and emit failed artifact snapshot.

summary.high_level: Defines a repeatable agent-operated session loop: ground context, execute constrained tasks, close out with strict contract, and feed audit metrics back into planning.
Indexes Kalshi pipeline session artifacts and preserves the handoff context toward Phase 9 planning.

data.title: KPI Dashboard v0

summary.high_level: Defines a file-based KPI dashboard for second-brain health with agent-delegable metrics computed from workflows.
summary.details: Computes principle-linked %, closeout pass rate, resumption quality, orphan ratio, core-project coverage, health score, and trend deltas using sessions/scenes/graph outputs. Produces metrics JSON + alert candidates with high cold-start resumability.

data.resumption_notes: Load taxonomy + alias policy, sessions indexes/artifacts, and graph/canonical outputs. Recompute from scratch in under two minutes.
open_questions: 1. Should dashboard include rolling 7-day and 30-day deltas by default?
2. Should low KPI alerts auto-append to OPEN_QUESTIONS.md or remain agent-internal first?
3. Should KPI scope expand to sub-project profiles (for example kalshi_15m_btc_pipeline)?
next_steps: 1. Run tools/sb_kpi_compute_v0.sh and validate metrics/alerts output.
2. Add optional weekly trigger in meta-program flow for periodic dashboard recompute.
3. Feed dashboard deltas into vision-alignment audit closeout.
thinking_trace_attachments: Keep KPI compute portable (file-I/O only), deterministic, and agent-runnable; defer visualization dependencies.

prompt_lineage.summary: Expand KPI dashboard into agent-consumable protocol with alerts and trends

kpi_dashboard_protocol.overview: Agent-runnable protocol to compute, store, and alert on KPI health with file-I/O only.
non_goals: KPIs never gate commits, closeouts, or merges.
KPIs may raise alerts and propose actions only.

load_sequence: 5. (Optional) Terminology standard from meta/TERMINOLOGY_STANDARD_v0.md for term fidelity tracking
prerequisites.assumptions: No external APIs/DB; Bash/jq/Python available locally.

phase_1_aggregate_data.description: Scan raw sources and compute base metrics.
actions: Compute coverage_from_core when graph is available

phase_2_evaluate_and_alert.description: Compare metrics to alert thresholds and generate actionable alerts (track-only).

on_violation: Emit alert item with kpi_name, value, threshold, severity, suggested_actions
on_repeat_violation: Escalate severity if violated in >=2 consecutive runs

actions: For KPI violations that are artifact-attributable, include top offenders as artifact IDs

phase_3_store_and_visualize.description: Persist structured metrics and provide lightweight operator-friendly view.
actions: Ingest updated scene/report pointers via graph ingest

resumption_primitives.audit_integration: Feed metrics into vision-alignment audit loop

delegability_pct.definition: Pct of artifacts in window that are executable by a fresh agent/human (actionable handoff).
delegability_pct.formula: count(artifact where resumption_score>=8 AND next_steps_count>=1 AND (principle_links_count>=2 OR tool_links_count>=1)) / total * 100
delegability_pct.notes: Delegability is not identical to resumption; it requires actionability.

term_fidelity_pct.notes: Track-only. Do not gate. Prefer counting violations with offender IDs.

governance_interruptions_per_run.definition: Count of hard-gate failures + required manual fixups per run (avoid time-based friction).
governance_interruptions_per_run.notes: Optional. Only include if it reduces entropy without adding upkeep.

summary.high_level: Defines canonical project ID policy for second-brain core and deprecates legacy alias IDs while preserving historical artifacts.

data.title: Prompt workflow inventory for session lifecycle

summary.high_level: Maps prompt files used to start and close sessions, including Kalshi-focused closure prompts and schema-driven archive prompts.

data.title: Second-brain commit and index toolchain map

summary.high_level: Maps the concrete local tooling that commits session artifacts and maintains index files.
Defines structure and maintenance rules for sessions/<tool>/index.json files.

data.label: Spec Spec v0
data.description: Higher-order spec from which all other specs derive. Defines required sections, governance invariants, naming, versioning, and status lifecycle.

summary.high_level: Tracks first-order vision-alignment KPI for session closure quality and principle-link discipline.

data.title: Operational workflow model for second-brain sessions

summary.high_level: Formalized the working workflow into a disciplined operational model. Clarified that sessions are state transitions, artifacts are durable state snapshots, and resumption is deterministic rehydration.
key_points: Work must always attach to a project ID.
Sessions operate under explicit principle constraints.
Patterns provide structural bias and prevent architectural drift.
Every meaningful session must emit a structured artifact.
Artifacts encode decisions, deltas, and open questions.
Resumption loads prior state instead of restarting from memory.

summary.high_level: Refined understanding of the working workflow. Clarified that sessions function as state transitions in a cognitive state machine. Artifacts act as durable state snapshots enabling deterministic re-entry and agent replay.
summary.core_insight: The second brain is not a note system; it is a state machine for cognition. Each session represents a transition from State_n to State_n+1. Artifacts encode the transition.

data.label: Session archiver prompt template (filled schema copy)
base -> delta -> materialized lineage
data.description: Core derivation chain: a base prompt is transformed by ordered deltas into a materialized output with full replay metadata.

data.label: Commit agent contract (3-capability model)
data.definition: Minimal agent interface: grounding access (read project docs), commit access (write scenes/session artifacts), and maintenance access (reindex + validate).

data.label: Deterministic materialization
data.description: Same base + same ordered deltas must produce byte-identical output. Delta order: ascending numeric order, tie-break by id lexical order.

data.label: Hyperfast agent closeout protocol v0
data.definition: Operational protocol for agent-executed hyperfast sessions with deterministic closeout and graph fold-in hooks.

data.label: Kalshi Phase 9 handoff state
data.definition: State reached after Phase 8 closeout where Phase 9 scope, thresholds, and challenger policy-readiness criteria must be defined.

data.label: KPI dashboard protocol v0
data.definition: Protocol for computing and evaluating second-brain health KPIs from local artifacts.

data.label: principle_linked_artifact_pct
data.definition: Percent of non-trivial session artifacts linked to at least one canonical principle.

data.label: Project ID alias map
data.definition: Alias resolution map for project IDs. New links must use canonical IDs; legacy references remain valid for historical truth.

data.label: Project map grounding model
data.definition: Graph node defining repo location, canonical documents, and grounding order for agents before reasoning about a project.

data.label: PromptArtifact
data.description: Canonical prompt content unit (base or materialized). Required fields: id, type, title, content, version, status.

data.label: PromptDelta
data.description: Incremental transformation over a base prompt. Required fields: id, delta_type, patch, order, version, status.

data.label: Prompt-driven session closure
data.definition: Reusable prompts encode the required output contract so session closeout artifacts remain consistent and machine-parseable.

data.label: PromptMaterializationRun
data.description: Deterministic replay execution record. Required fields: id, base_prompt_id, applied_delta_ids[], output_prompt_id, generated_on.

data.label: PromptVariant
data.description: Named target variant for tool/context/domain specialization. Required fields: id, target_context, version, status.

data.label: Session index object schema
data.definition: Each sessions/<tool>/index.json file is a JSON object with fields: tool, artifacts[], last_updated.

data.label: Session index maintenance
data.definition: Keep sessions/<tool>/index.json synchronized with artifact IDs present in each sessions/<tool>/ directory.

data.label: Session index rebuild rule
data.definition: Index entries are derived from sessions/<tool>/*.json excluding index.json, producing artifacts[] records with id/date/resumption_score/summary_snippet.

data.label: Session index update policy
data.definition: On successful closeout, update sessions/<tool>/index.json automatically by default. Use --no-index only for bulk backfill, rollback, or controlled migration runs.

data.label: Spec
data.description: A versioned governance document with required sections: Title, Version, Status, Inputs, Purpose, Scope, Core Definitions, Determinism & Drift Tests, Governance Rules, Failure Modes, Success Criteria, Immediate Next Step.

data.label: Allowed spec status values
data.description: Allowed values: Experimental, Stable, Deprecated.

data.label: Spec derivation
data.description: Every spec is a concretion of the Spec Spec. Child specs must include all required sections and satisfy inherited governance invariants.

data.label: Spec filename pattern
data.description: Filename regex for spec artifacts: ^[A-Z][A-Z_]*_SPEC_v[0-9]+\.md$.

data.label: Spec required sections in canonical order
data.description: Canonical order: 1) Title, 2) Version, 3) Status, 4) Inputs, 5) Purpose, 6) Scope, 7) Core Definitions, 8) Determinism & Drift Tests, 9) Governance Rules, 10) Failure Modes, 11) Success Criteria (vN), 12) Immediate Next Step.

data.label: Spec status lifecycle
data.description: Experimental -> Stable -> Deprecated. Experimental allows breaking changes; Stable requires version bumps; Deprecated is read-only.

data.label: Spec versioning
data.description: Monotonically increasing vN integer per subject. Semantic/governance changes require a bump; editorial fixes do not.

data.label: Spec version string pattern
data.description: Version field must match pattern ^v[0-9]+$.

data.label: Vision-alignment anchor KPI
data.definition: principle_linked_artifact_pct = percent of non-trivial artifacts with at least one canonical principle link.

data.label: Workflow as cognitive state machine
data.definition: A model in which each session transitions a project from one defined cognitive state to another, with structured artifacts capturing the delta.

data.label: Zero-shot resumption bundle
data.definition: Minimal context load set for cold-start execution: core project scene + latest taxonomy + top 3 recent artifacts by resumption score.

data.label: Ontology: Finding Meaning in Data (Palantir RFx Blog Series #1)
data.summary: Palantir defines ontology as a semantic layer that maps raw data into real-world objects, relationships, and logic. It decouples data pipelines from applications and embeds meaning, permissions, and operations directly into a shared object model.

data.label: KPI tracks, does not enforce domain invariants
Agent resumption minimum
data.description: Target agent resumability score >=8 for delegated loops.

data.label: Derived view integrity
data.description: Graph remains derived from scenes with dry-run-first ingest safety.

data.label: Link density minimum
data.description: Session closeout artifact must maintain minimum link density >=2.

data.label: Observability entropy
data.description: Track entropy indicators with KPI metrics and alerts.

data.label: Preload ritual
data.description: Load Direction/Governance/Terminology context before action.

data.label: Structural legibility band
data.description: Structural legibility score remains >=16 baseline band.

data.label: Terminology fidelity post-v0
data.description: Terminology usage remains semantically consistent at 100% fidelity target.

data.label: Vision alignment
data.description: Artifacts remain aligned to core principles.

data.label: Claude computer-use + Obsidian + TypeScript agent on VPS
data.description: Claude’s computer-use plus a custom TypeScript agent on a VPS with Obsidian, guided by principle-level architectural best practices.

data.label: Dan's Codex + ChatGPT meta-workflow (v1)
data.description: Current working pattern where Dan uses Codex and ChatGPT as primary thinking surfaces: Codex for live project work, specs, and pipeline design; ChatGPT for higher-level reflection, summaries, and second-brain architecture thinking. Knowledge currently lives mostly in conversations and ad-hoc notes, with an emerging intention to turn high-value threads into graph-structured artifacts.

capture_points: Codex conversations for active builds (specs, trading pipeline design, ML ideas)
ChatGPT threads for meta-analysis, second brain architecture, and workflow reflection
Occasional external docs/notes (e.g., Neovim config, trading research, YouTube/video transcripts)
storage_today: Local config/code repos (e.g., Neovim, trading infra)
Ad-hoc notes/docs when something feels important
intended_future_storage: Graph-structured knowledge base (principles, patterns, concepts, projects, tools)
Artifacts like this video summary encoded as nodes/edges
Project-scoped state snapshots for resumption and meta-analysis
ai_roles: Spec drafting and refinement partner (Codex + ChatGPT)
Future: graph-aware agent that can traverse principles/patterns/projects and propose changes
human_roles: Define intent and constraints for projects (trading, infra, second brain)
Curate which artifacts become first-class graph nodes
Decide when to standardize patterns vs leave things experimental
notable_characteristics: Session-based interactions with Codex tied to concrete work (coding, specs, trading pipeline design)
Higher-level, cross-project reflection done in separate meta threads with ChatGPT
Growing preference for principled, architecture-first thinking over tool-first setups
Explicit interest in resilience to tool churn and context-window limits

data.label: Discord + Obsidian + MacWhisper capture stack
data.description: Discord as capture surface, MacWhisper for local transcription, and Obsidian for storage; slash commands trigger processing and filing by project.

data.label: Prompt lineage drift tests
data.description: Four invariance tests: repeat-run stability, permutation invariance, supersession stability, missing-delta failure.

data.label: Hyperfast agent session loop
data.description: Ground -> Execute -> Validate -> Closeout -> Reindex -> Audit -> Plan.

data.label: KPI dashboard audit loop
data.description: Compute -> evaluate -> alert -> ingest -> iterate loop for infrastructure health.

data.label: Meta-agent framework orchestrating multiple coding assistants
data.description: A meta-agent coordinating Claude Code, Codex, Copilot, and Goose using a writer–critic loop, capable of setting up infra and generating UIs.

data.label: Notion mobile capture + scheduled Claude processing
data.description: Notion mobile export as capture mechanism, with Claude periodically processing an inbox and sorting into structured views.

data.label: Notion + Zapier + Claude/ChatGPT second brain stack
data.description: Capture and route notes using Notion for storage, Zapier for automation, and Claude or ChatGPT as the intelligence layer.

data.label: Postgres + vector DB + graph DB as second brain infrastructure
data.description: Hybrid database system: Postgres for structured data, vector DB for semantic search, and Neo4j for relationships, exposed via API/SDK.

data.label: Prompt ID naming convention
data.description: Prompt IDs: prompt/<domain>_<purpose>_vN. Delta IDs: prompt_delta/<base>_<order>_<intent>_vN. Materialized IDs: prompt/<base>__<variant>_vN.

data.label: Session → Artifact → Resumption loop
data.description: A disciplined loop where sessions begin with declared constraints, end with structured artifacts, and future sessions resume from those artifacts.

data.label: Session → Artifact → Resumption loop
data.description: Each work session emits a structured artifact capturing decisions, changes, and open questions. Future sessions begin by rehydrating from that artifact.

data.label: Slack capture + local YAML + Claude Code session-based processing
data.description: Slack as capture, local YAML files as storage, and Claude Code sessions that process inbox items, classify them, and write YAML on demand.

data.label: Child spec derivation contract
data.description: Child spec must include all required sections, follow filename/version/status constraints, inherit governance invariants, and only add domain-specific sections in optional placement.

data.label: Spec drift test suite
data.description: Minimum checks: repeat-run stability, required-section completeness, filename regex conformance, and deterministic rendering from structured form.

data.label: Spec naming convention
data.description: <SCOPE>_<SUBJECT>_SPEC_vN.md — uppercase scope, optional subject, version integer.

data.label: Optional spec sections
data.description: Optional sections: Architecture and Cross-Artifact Constraints. If present, place them between Scope and Determinism & Drift Tests.

data.label: 12 required spec sections
data.description: Title, Version, Status, Inputs, Purpose, Scope, Core Definitions, Determinism & Drift Tests, Governance Rules, Failure Modes, Success Criteria, Immediate Next Step.

data.label: Standalone CLI commit pattern
data.description: A local-first command-line tool that writes scene/session JSON, validates structure, and maintains indexes without requiring database infrastructure.

data.label: Zapier Slack → Claude → Notion classification flow
data.description: Slack messages trigger a Zapier flow that calls Claude for JSON classification, cleans/parses results, routes to Notion DBs, logs inbox entries, and replies in Slack.

data.label: If the agent builds it, the agent can maintain it
Architecture is portable, tools are not
No in-place semantic mutation of historical prompts
Principles-based guidance scales better than rules
Your system can be infrastructure, not just a tool
Kalshi 15m BTC Pipeline
data.purpose: Reliable, reproducible, and auditable pipeline for ingesting, normalizing, and validating Kalshi BTC 15-minute market data.
notes_for_agents: Treat README as the entrypoint for intent + commands.
Treat PLAN as the canonical roadmap / planning truth.
Treat OPEN_QUESTIONS as the canonical unresolved decision space.
Treat AGENTS as durable workflow + execution rules.
Use checkpoints as milestone snapshots; use specs for architecture contracts; use reports for results.

data.label: Agent Ontology
data.summary: A minimal, practical ontology for LLM-powered agents: what exists in the agent's world model, how it plans, acts, remembers, and learns.

data.label: ChatGPT (meta-reflection + architecture)
data.description: ChatGPT used primarily for higher-level reflection, second-brain architecture, and workflow/meta-analysis separate from day-to-day execution.

data.label: Codex (project + spec environment)
data.description: Codex environment where Dan runs active builds, specs, and pipeline design work, often in longer-running threads focused on specific projects.

data.label: Second-brain CLI (sb)
data.description: Local CLI for committing scenes/sessions, validating JSON, and rebuilding session indexes.

data.label: Session index updater script
data.description: Script that scans sessions directories and updates per-tool index.json files.
A delta transforms a base PromptArtifact.
A delta specializes toward a named variant.
A run produces a materialized PromptArtifact from base + deltas.
